data.label: ChatOllama
data.name: chatOllama
data.description: Chat completion using open-source LLM on Ollama

inputParams.label: Temperature
inputParams.name: temperature
inputParams.description: The temperature of the model. Increasing the temperature will make the model answer more creatively. (Default: 0.8). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Allow image input. Refer to the docs for more details.

inputParams.label: JSON Mode
inputParams.name: jsonMode
inputParams.description: Coerces model outputs to only return JSON. Specify in the system prompt to return JSON. Ex: Format all responses as JSON object

inputParams.label: Keep Alive
inputParams.name: keepAlive
inputParams.description: How long to keep connection alive. A duration string (such as "10m" or "24h")

inputParams.label: Top P
inputParams.name: topP
inputParams.description: Works together with top-k. A higher value (e.g., 0.95) will lead to more diverse text, while a lower value (e.g., 0.5) will generate more focused and conservative text. (Default: 0.9). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Top K
inputParams.name: topK
inputParams.description: Reduces the probability of generating nonsense. A higher value (e.g. 100) will give more diverse answers, while a lower value (e.g. 10) will be more conservative. (Default: 40). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat
inputParams.name: mirostat
inputParams.description: Enable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity. (default: 0, 0 = disabled, 1 = Mirostat, 2 = Mirostat 2.0). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat ETA
inputParams.name: mirostatEta
inputParams.description: Influences how quickly the algorithm responds to feedback from the generated text. A lower learning rate will result in slower adjustments, while a higher learning rate will make the algorithm more responsive. (Default: 0.1) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat TAU
inputParams.name: mirostatTau
inputParams.description: Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. A lower value will result in more focused and coherent text. (Default: 5.0) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Context Window Size
inputParams.name: numCtx
inputParams.description: Sets the size of the context window used to generate the next token. (Default: 2048) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of GPU
inputParams.name: numGpu
inputParams.description: The number of layers to send to the GPU(s). On macOS it defaults to 1 to enable metal support, 0 to disable. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of Thread
inputParams.name: numThread
inputParams.description: Sets the number of threads to use during computation. By default, Ollama will detect this for optimal performance. It is recommended to set this value to the number of physical CPU cores your system has (as opposed to the logical number of cores). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Repeat Last N
inputParams.name: repeatLastN
inputParams.description: Sets how far back for the model to look back to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Repeat Penalty
inputParams.name: repeatPenalty
inputParams.description: Sets how strongly to penalize repetitions. A higher value (e.g., 1.5) will penalize repetitions more strongly, while a lower value (e.g., 0.9) will be more lenient. (Default: 1.1). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stop
inputParams.description: Sets the stop sequences to use. Use comma to seperate different sequences. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Tail Free Sampling
inputParams.name: tfsZ
inputParams.description: Tail free sampling is used to reduce the impact of less probable tokens from the output. A higher value (e.g., 2.0) will reduce the impact more, while a value of 1.0 disables this setting. (Default: 1). Refer to docs for more details

outputAnchors.name: chatOllama
outputAnchors.label: ChatOllama
outputAnchors.description: Chat completion using open-source LLM on Ollama

data.label: LLM Node
data.name: seqLLMNode
data.description: Run Chat Model and return the output

inputParams.label: Prepend Messages History
inputParams.name: messageHistory
inputParams.description: Prepend a list of messages between System Prompt and Human Prompt. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

inputParams.label: Conversation History
inputParams.name: conversationHistorySelection

options.label: User Question
options.name: user_question
options.description: Use the user question from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Last Conversation Message
options.name: last_message
options.description: Use the last conversation message from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: All Conversation Messages
options.name: all_messages
options.description: Use all conversation messages from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Empty
options.name: empty
options.description: Do not use any messages from the conversation history. Ensure to use either System Prompt, Human Prompt, or Messages History.

inputParams.description: Select which messages from the conversation history to include in the prompt. The selected messages will be inserted between the System Prompt (if defined) and [Messages History, Human Prompt].

inputParams.label: Human Prompt
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.label: Format Prompt Values
inputParams.name: promptValues
inputParams.description: Assign values to the prompt variables. You can also use $flow.state.<variable-name> to get the state value

inputParams.label: JSON Structured Output
inputParams.name: llmStructuredOutput
inputParams.description: Instruct the LLM to give output in a JSON structured schema

tabs.label: Update State (Table)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryUI

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Key and value pair to be updated. For example: if you have the following State:
    | Key       | Operation     | Default Value     |
    |-----------|---------------|-------------------|
    | user      | Replace       |                   |

    You can update the "user" value with the following:
    | Key       | Value     |
    |-----------|-----------|
    | user      | john doe  |

2. If you want to use the LLM Node's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$flow.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": 'Hello! How can I assist you today?',
        "name": "",
        "additional_kwargs": {},
        "response_metadata": {},
        "tool_calls": [],
        "invalid_tool_calls": [],
        "usage_metadata": {}
    }
    ```

    For example, if the output `content` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                     |
    |-----------|---------------------------|
    | user      | `$flow.output.content`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$flow.sessionId`
    - `$flow.chatId`
    - `$flow.chatflowId`
    - `$flow.input`
    - `$flow.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values

tabs.label: Update State (Code)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryCode

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Return the key value JSON object. For example: if you have the following State:
    ```json
    {
        "user": null
    }
    ```

    You can update the "user" value by returning the following:
    ```js
    return {
        "user": "john doe"
    }
    ```

2. If you want to use the LLM Node's output as the value to update state, it is available as `$flow.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": 'Hello! How can I assist you today?',
        "name": "",
        "additional_kwargs": {},
        "response_metadata": {},
        "tool_calls": [],
        "invalid_tool_calls": [],
        "usage_metadata": {}
    }
    ```

    For example, if the output `content` is the value you want to update the state with, you can return the following:
    ```js
    return {
        "user": $flow.output.content
    }
    ```

3. You can also get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$flow.sessionId`
    - `$flow.chatId`
    - `$flow.chatflowId`
    - `$flow.input`
    - `$flow.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values. Must return an object representing the state

data.label: Condition Agent
data.name: seqConditionAgent
data.description: Uses an agent to determine which route to take next

inputParams.label: System Prompt
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.default:
You are an expert customer support routing system.
Your job is to detect whether a customer support representative is routing a user to the technical support team, or just responding conversationally.

inputParams.label: Conversation History
inputParams.name: conversationHistorySelection

options.label: User Question
options.name: user_question
options.description: Use the user question from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Last Conversation Message
options.name: last_message
options.description: Use the last conversation message from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: All Conversation Messages
options.name: all_messages
options.description: Use all conversation messages from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Empty
options.name: empty
options.description: Do not use any messages from the conversation history. Ensure to use either System Prompt, Human Prompt, or Messages History.

inputParams.description: Select which messages from the conversation history to include in the prompt. The selected messages will be inserted between the System Prompt (if defined) and Human Prompt.

inputParams.label: Human Prompt
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message
inputParams.default:
The previous conversation is an interaction between a customer support representative and a user.
Extract whether the representative is routing the user to the technical support team, or just responding conversationally.

If representative want to route the user to the technical support team, respond only with the word "TECHNICAL".
Otherwise, respond only with the word "CONVERSATION".

Remember, only respond with one of the above words.

inputParams.name: promptValues
inputParams.description: Assign values to the prompt variables. You can also use $flow.state.<variable-name> to get the state value

inputParams.description: Instruct the LLM to give output in a JSON structured schema

data.label: State
data.name: seqState
data.description: A centralized state object, updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another

tabs.label: Custom State (Table)
tabs.name: stateMemoryUI
tabs.description: Structure for state. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
Specify the Key, Operation Type, and Default Value for the state object. The Operation Type can be either "Replace" or "Append".

**Replace**
- Replace the existing value with the new value.
- If the new value is null, the existing value will be retained.

**Append**
- Append the new value to the existing value.
- Default value can be empty or an array. Ex: ["a", "b"]
- Final value is an array.

tabs.label: Custom State (Code)
tabs.name: stateMemoryCode

outputAnchors.name: seqState
outputAnchors.label: State
outputAnchors.description: A centralized state object, updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another

inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Only compatible with models that are capable of function calling: ChatOpenAI, ChatMistral, ChatAnthropic, ChatGoogleGenerativeAI, ChatVertexAI, GroqChat

inputAnchors.label: Agent Memory
inputAnchors.name: agentMemory
inputAnchors.description: Save the state of the agent

inputAnchors.label: State
inputAnchors.name: state
inputAnchors.description: State is an object that is updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration
